Text saved: Freud was a famous doctor. He studied people's minds.

About 200 years ago, two big ideas about dreams were popular.
One idea was this: Dreams show us secret things.
These things are in our brain.
We do not know them when we are awake.
Freud thought this: If we know what dreams mean, we can know our secret feelings.
We can also know our problems.

But the other idea was different.
It said dreams are just many mixed-up things.
They happen in our brain.
Our brain puts memories in order from the day.
When we wake up, we try to understand these pictures and feelings.
We try to make them into a story.
